name: Discovery Quality Rubric
description: Evaluates quality of discovery questions, active listening, and comprehensive 5 Wins framework coverage (Business, Technical, Security, Commercial, Legal)

scoring_guide.90-100: Exceptional discovery - thorough coverage across all 5 Wins, insightful follow-up questions, active listening demonstrated
scoring_guide.80-89: Strong discovery - good coverage of 3-4 Wins with depth, some missed opportunities for deeper probing
scoring_guide.70-79: Adequate discovery - basic qualification achieved across 2-3 Wins, but lacks depth or misses key elements
scoring_guide.60-69: Weak discovery - superficial questions across 1-2 Wins, poor listening, minimal qualification
scoring_guide.0-59: Poor discovery - primarily presenting without understanding customer needs, <1 Win covered

question_quality.description: Quality and depth of questions asked across all discovery dimensions

excellent: Open-ended questions that uncover business, technical, security, and commercial needs
Follow-up questions that dig deeper into responses
Questions reveal priorities and decision criteria across all stakeholder groups
Probing questions to understand pain points and requirements thoroughly
poor: Questions focused on product features vs. business/technical needs
Asking questions already answered in prep materials
Only focusing on one stakeholder group (e.g., engineering) without exploring others

active_listening.description: Demonstrates listening and building on customer responses

excellent: References specific customer statements in responses
Paraphrases customer concerns to confirm understanding
Connects current topic to earlier customer statements
poor: Provides generic responses not tailored to customer input
Doesn't acknowledge or build on customer concerns

five_wins_coverage.description: Covers the comprehensive 5 Wins qualification framework (Business, Technical, Security, Commercial, Legal)

business_discovery.current_state_and_problems: Explores current challenges, pain points, and consequences of inaction
business_discovery.future_state_and_outcomes: Uncovers desired outcomes and success criteria for solution
business_discovery.success_metrics: Quantifies business impact (time saved, cost reduction, efficiency gains, revenue impact)
business_discovery.executive_priorities: Understands executive-level goals and strategic initiatives driving this evaluation
business_discovery.evaluation_and_decision: Maps out decision process, timeline, stakeholders, and approval steps

components.business_case: Validates buying team can build effective case for 'Why change?', 'Why Prefect?', 'Why now?' to secure resources

technical_discovery.technical_requirements: Identifies technical constraints, integration needs, and must-have capabilities
technical_discovery.use_case_alignment: Validates Prefect fits primary use cases and workflows
technical_discovery.infrastructure_requirements: Understands infrastructure (cloud, on-prem, hybrid), scale, and deployment preferences
technical_discovery.ci_cd_requirements: Maps out CI/CD integration needs and deployment pipelines
technical_discovery.other_requirements: Security, compliance, monitoring, observability, and operational requirements

components.demo_solution_presentation: Plans tailored demo with AE and SE showing solution to business and technical discovery with all key stakeholders
components.poc_scoping_and_poc: Agrees on POC scope and validates POC completion with Prefect winning voice-of-customer

infosec_discovery.infosec_requirements: Identifies security, compliance, and data privacy requirements (SOC 2, HIPAA, GDPR, etc.)
infosec_discovery.infosec_process_and_timeline: Understands InfoSec review process, stakeholders, and timeline for approval
infosec_discovery.questionnaire: Determines if security questionnaire is required and timeline for completion

components.scoping_discovery: Determines required scope of product, usage levels, support tier, and services needed

components.legal_discovery: Identifies legal review requirements, contract terms concerns, procurement process, and legal stakeholders

scoring.5_wins: Excellent - comprehensive discovery across all dimensions
scoring.3-4_wins: Good - solid coverage with gaps in 1-2 areas
scoring.2_wins: Needs improvement - superficial discovery, major gaps

talk_listen_ratio.description: Balance of talking vs. listening during discovery

strong_business_discovery.quote: You mentioned your data engineers spend 40% of their time debugging Airflow DAGs. Can you walk me through a recent example? What was the root cause, and how long did resolution take? More importantly, what strategic projects are on hold because of this maintenance burden? And when you think about next quarter's roadmap, what would success look like if this problem went away?
strong_business_discovery.analysis: Excellent multi-layered discovery: quantifies pain (40%), asks for specific example (current state), probes business impact (strategic projects on hold), and explores future state outcomes. Demonstrates active listening and connects to executive priorities.

strong_technical_discovery.quote: Got it - so you're running Airflow on Kubernetes with about 500 daily DAGs. Tell me about your deployment pipeline - how do you promote DAG changes from dev to production? And when you think about integrating with your data warehouse, what are the critical requirements there?
strong_technical_discovery.analysis: Covers infrastructure (Kubernetes), scale (500 DAGs), CI/CD requirements (promotion process), and integration requirements (data warehouse). Shows understanding of technical landscape and probes for specific requirements.

strong_security_discovery.quote: I saw you're in healthcare - what compliance requirements do we need to meet? HIPAA? And walk me through your InfoSec review process - who needs to sign off, and what's the typical timeline? Do you have a standard security questionnaire we should plan for?
strong_security_discovery.analysis: Proactively addresses industry-specific compliance (HIPAA), maps InfoSec process and stakeholders, and plans ahead for questionnaire. Shows understanding of security gate in sales cycle.

weak_discovery.quote: So you're looking for a workflow orchestration tool?
weak_discovery.analysis: Closed question that doesn't uncover needs. Assumes intent without exploring current challenges, desired outcomes, or any of the 5 Wins dimensions. Completely misses opportunity for comprehensive discovery.
